Yoruba: Aṣojú àjọ àgbáyé ní ẹ̀ka ètò tó ń rí sí gbígbógun tí àrùn kògbóògùn Erasmus Murah l"ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi ètò tí àjọ t"ó ń gbógunti àrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà NIBUCAA ṣe nílùú Àbújá, lọ́jọ́Rú ọ̀ṣẹ̀ yìí.

English: Musa Shuabu, who is the chairman of NIBUCAA also said the plan to allow private companies in Nigeria cooperate with federal government to fight HIV/AIDS started fifteen years ago during President Olusegun Obasanjo government.
Yoruba: Musa Shuabu, alága ìgbìmọ̀ àjọ NiBUCAA náà sọ pé ìpinnu láti jẹ́ kí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti gbógun ti àrùn kòkòrò inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ àti àrùn kògbóògùn (HIV/AIDS) bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ọdún màrúndínlógún ṣéyìn lásìkò ìjọba Ààrẹ àna olúṣégun Ọbásanjọ́.

English: Musa Shuabu said "we have accomplished our plan, because of our love to Nigeria to separate a day to fight the spread of incurable disease.
Yoruba: Musa Shuabu sọ pé "a ti mú ìpinnu wá ṣẹ, nítorí ìfẹ́ tí a ní sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti dá àjọ kan sílẹ, ti yóò máa gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kògbóògùn.

English: NIBUCAA founded fifteen years ago by some people, has become famous in the whole world.
Yoruba: Ajọ NIBUCAA tí àwọn kán dá sílẹ̀ ní ọdún màrúndínlógún sẹ́yìn, ni ó ti di gbajú-gbajà káàkiri gbogbo àgbáyé.

English: Musa Shuabu thanked companies and orgniations for their support for about fifteen years ago to fight the spread of the incurable disease in Nigeria, though the organization is facing a challenge.
Yoruba: Musa Shuabu wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo àwọn ilẹ́-iṣẹ́ àti àjọ fún àtileyin wọn láti bí i ọdún màrúndínlógún ṣẹ́yìn láti gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn ìpẹ̀níjà kán wà tó ń kojú àjọ náà.

English: The appealed to them not to relent in supporting NIBUCAA the more because there is more work to be done.
Yoruba: Ó tún wà rọ̀ wọn láti má káàárẹ láti túbọ̀ máa ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn fún àjọ NIBUCAA, nítorí pé iṣẹ́ si tún ń bẹ láti ṣe.

English: The Director NIBUCAA, Gbenga Alabi also said the cooperation of private companies with the government to fight the incurable disease is very important because no single hand can do the work.
Yoruba: Alákóòso àjọ NIBUCAA, Gbénga Àlàbí náà tún sọ pé ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni pẹ̀lú ìjọba láti gbógun ti àrùn kògbóògùn ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ nítorí pé ọwọ́ kan kò gbẹ́rù dórí.

English: We have thirty-seven (37) members now and there is more opportunity to take more member that wish to join us, so that we can together fight the incurable disease in Nigeria.
Yoruba: A ti ní ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ mẹ́tàdínlógójì báyìí síbẹ̀ àǹfààní ṣì wà láti gba àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tuntun tó bá fẹ́ darapọ̀ mọ́ wa, kí a lè jọ gbógunti ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Mr. Gbenga Alabi continued that NIBUCAA also join hands with NACA in Nigeria to fight incurable disease and so many successes are recorded through the cooperate work.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Gbénga Àlàbí tún tẹ̀síwájú pé àjọ NIBUCAA tún ń fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé-iṣẹ́ NACA lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti gbógun ti àrùn kògbóògùn, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àṣeyọrí ni wọ́n ti ṣe nípa ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ yìí.

English: He then appealed to private companies not to relent in their help in fighting incurable diseases in Nigeria the more.
Yoruba: Ó wá rọ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni láti má káàárẹ̀ nípa ìrànwọ́ wọn láti túbọ̀ gbógun ti àrùn kògbòógùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà

English: He continued that NIBUCAA has recorded many successes to stop the spread of incurable disease in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àṣeyọrí ni àjọ NiBUCAA ti ṣe láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Alabi said NIBUCAA in relation with the supporters has done much in Nigeria in fighting the incurable disease.
Yoruba: Àlàbí sọ pé "Àjọ NIBUCAA pẹ̀lú ìbáṣepọ̀ àwọn olùrànlọ́wọ́ ti ṣe gudu-dudu méje, yàyà mẹfà lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, láti gbógun ti àrùn kògbóògùn.

English: NIBUCAA has helped the following states.
Yoruba: Àjọ NIBUCAA ti ran àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ wọ̀nyí lọ́wọ́.

English: The states are: Abia, Anambra, Akwa-Ibom, Cross River, Edo, Abuja, Kaduna, Katsina, Ekiti, Imo, Enugu, Katsina, Plateau and Oyo state.
Yoruba: Àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ náà ni: Abia, Anambra, Akwa-Ibom, Cross River, Edo, FCT, Kaduna, Katsina, Èkìtì, Imo, Enugu, Katsina, Plateau àti ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.

English: After deliberation, the private organizations, government organizations and the concerned concluded on these decisions:
Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ìjíròrò ni àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni, ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba àti àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ kàn fẹnukò lórí ípinnu wọ̀nyìí,:

English: ---Nigeria pledges technical support to Sao Tome and Principe
Yoruba: ---Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ṣèlérí láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún Sao Tome àti Principe.

English: Nigeria has pledged technical support to Sao Tome and Principe on the country's Parliamentary election scheduled for October 7 this year.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ṣèlérí láti pèsè ètò ìránwọ́ lórí iṣẹ́ àkànṣe fún orílẹ̀-èdè Sao Tome àti Principe lásìkò ètò ìdìbò ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú-ṣòfin orílẹ̀-èdè náà, ti yóò wáyé ní ọjọ́ keje oṣù Kẹwàá ọdún yìí

English: The Nigerian Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mr. Geoffrey Onyeama disclosed this in an interview with Journalists at the valedictory session to mark the retirement of Ambassador Olukunle Bamgbose, the Permanent Secretary in the Federal Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ọrọ̀ ilé òkèèrè lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Geoffrey Onyeama ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìfọ̀rọ̀wérò, pẹ̀lú àwọn akọròyìn láti fi ṣe ayẹyẹ ìfẹ̀yìntì lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ fún Olúkúnlé Bámgbóṣé, t"ó jẹ́ akọ̀wé àgbà fún àjọ tó ń mójútó ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.

English: Mr. Onyeama said he embarked on a visit to Sao Tome and Principe to represent President Muhammadu Buhari, on modalities to provide technical support to the country.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Onyeama sọ pé, òun lọ ṣojú Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nìàjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ní orílẹ̀-èdè Sao Tome àti Principe nípa ọ̀nà tí wọn yóò gbà láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ iṣẹ́ àkànṣe fún orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: "It was to provide technical assistance to Sao Tome and Principe, the country is having election very soon and we are very keen, and we are working towards how to make it peaceful," explained Mr. Onyeama.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Onyeama ṣ"àlàyé pé "nípa ọ̀nà tí a ó gbà láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ iṣẹ́ àkànṣe fún orílẹ̀-èdè Sao Tome àti Principe ni a ṣe rán mi lọ síbẹ̀.

English: According to him, "Mr. President really believe and is interested in supporting neighbouring countries, so it was part of what made the president to send assistance to them."
Yoruba: "Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé, "Ààrẹ nígbàgbọ́ láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó fẹ̀gbẹ́kẹ̀gbẹ́ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ìdí nìyí tí Ààrẹ ṣe pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún wọn."

English: On the retiring Permanent Secretary, Ambassador Bamgbose, the Minister commended him for his hard work and contribution to the development of the Ministry.
Yoruba: "Mínísítà wá gbóṣùbà fún akọ̀wé àgbà àná, Bámgbóṣé, fún iṣẹ́ ribi-ribi tí o ṣe láti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá àjo náà.

English: "He is a hardworking man that is ready to put his best; he has all the qualities that I admire, very hard working, very loyal as well.
Yoruba: "Ó jẹ́ akínkanjú ènìyàn, tí ó fẹ́ láti fi gbogbo ọkàn rẹ̀ ṣe iṣẹ́ rẹ̀, ó ní gbogbo ìwà àbùdá ènìyàn rere, ó jẹ́ olóòótọ́ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́, mo sì fẹ́ràn rẹ̀.

English: "I like his kind of person, if he doesn't agree with me, he will tell me why he doesn't; he will advise me and he was very productive; so we really enjoyed him," he said.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé "Mo fẹ́ràn irú ènìyàn báyìí láti bá ṣe iṣẹ́ papọ̀, tí kò bá fẹ́ nǹkan kan, yóò ṣàlàyé fún mi, á sì tún gbà mí nímọ̀ràn, ìdí tí kò ṣe fẹ́ irú rẹ̀, nítorí náà, a fẹ́ràn ara wa.

English: Ambassador Bamgbose in his remarks said that he was fulfilled as a Permanent Secretary, adding that he achieved all his set goals in that position.
Yoruba: "Bámgbóṣé náà wá sọ pé, inú òun dùn láti jẹ́ akòwé àgbà fún àjọ náà, àti pé gbogbo ìpinnu òun, ni òún mú sẹ fún àjo náà lásìkò tó wà lórí ipò náà.

English: "I came up with "quick wins," and in one year, all the things I thought I could do, I did all of them, so I am going out as a Permanent Secretary fulfilled.
Yoruba: "Mo wà láti wá pẹ̀lú "ìborí wéréwéré," láàárín ọdún kan, gbogbo ìpinnu mi, ni mo mú ṣe, nítorí náà, mò ń lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Akọ̀wé Àgbà aláṣeyọrí.

English: "I am not going with any regrets because I did all I was supposed to do.
Yoruba: "Èmi ò lọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹni tí inú rẹ̀ ń bàjẹ́, mo ti ṣe ohun t"ó yẹ kí n ṣe.

English: "I am fully satisfied now that I addressed some of the challenges identified when I was growing up in the Ministry."
Yoruba: "Inú mí dùn pé, mo kọjú àwọn ìpèníjà tí mo bá lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ yìí, mo sc sẹ àṣeyọrí lórí rẹ̀."

English: In his own words "What is important is that the work is continuous, I have done my own part, others will also do theirs, when you do your bit, things will move forward.
Yoruba: Ní ọ̀rọ̀ tirẹ̀ "ohun tí ó ṣe kókó ni pé iṣẹ́ ń tẹ̀síwájú, mo ti ṣe tèmi, àwọn yòókù yóò ṣe ti wọn, tí o bá ṣe ìwọn tìrẹ, iṣẹ́ yóò lọ síwájú.

English: "I am challenging the officers behind me to follow some of the things I laid down.
Yoruba: "Mò ń rọ èyin t"ó wà lẹ́yìn mi, láti tẹ̀lẹ́ gbogbo ìlànà tí mo ti là sílè.

English: "With the combined efforts, we can make some changes in the Foreign Services with beautiful decisions, every officer can come and serve and make impact," he said.
Yoruba: "Pẹ̀lú àjọṣepọ̀, a le è ṣe àṣeyọrí lórí àwọn ìpèníjà tí a ń dojúko nílé iṣẹ́ wa.

English: The outgoing Permanent Secretary urged the staff of the Ministry to remain focused and sustain the legacy he left behind.
Yoruba: Akòwe àgbà tí ó ń lọ náà wá rọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ àjọ náà, láti má káàárẹ̀ lórí ìgbìyànjú wọn, kí wọ́n sì fi àpẹẹrẹ rere lélẹ.

English: Ambassador Olukunle Bamgbose is retiring after spending thirty-five years in the Foreign Service.
Yoruba: Aṣojú Olúkúnlé Bámgbóṣé ń fẹ̀yìntì lẹ́yìn ọdún márùndínlógójì tí ó lò lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìjọba ní àjọ náà.

English: ---ECOWAS countries pledge to do more business with China
Yoruba: ---Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè t"ó wà lábẹ́ ECOWAS ṣèlérí láti ṣe okoòwò pẹ̀lú China.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari says countries within the West Africa region will continue to do business with China because of the strong ties that exist between them and the Asian country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà lábẹ́ àjọ ECOWAS yóò tẹ̀síwájú láti máa ṣe okòòwò pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè China nítorí ìbáṣepọ tó dán mọ́ọ́rán tó wà láàárín wọn àti àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Asian.

English: He made the commitment on Monday, in his capacity as the Chairman of ECOWAS, at the opening of the high-level dialogue between Chinese and African leaders in China.
Yoruba: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé, gẹ́gẹ́ bí Alága àjọ ECOWAS níbi ìpàdé tó wáyé láàárín àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè China àti àwọn adarí orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà ní China.

English: President Buhari said the recent tour of the region by Chinese President, Xi Jinping highlighted the importance of closer ties with China.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ni ìrìnàjo ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè China Xi Jinping ti ṣàlàyé ni pàtàkì ìbáṣepọ̀ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà.

English: He said: "ECOWAS Member States will continue to pay emphasis on encouraging more foreign direct investment in the sub-region.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ sọ pé: "Àjọ ECOWAS yóò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti máa ṣe ohun ìwúrí fún àwọn t"ó bá dá okoòwò sílẹ̀ láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.

English: To this end, Member States are looking at the opportunities that the China International Import-Export initiative will offer our exporters to gain market access for their goods and services in China.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ECOWAS ń fẹ́ kí orílẹ̀-èdè China fún wọn ní àǹfààní láti máa rà tàbí ta ọjà sí orílẹ̀-èdè China.

English: "Such an opportunity will help in diversifying the economy of our sub-region from over reliance on primary agricultural and mineral products and subsequently correct the huge trade imbalance between China and the ECOWAS sub-region on a win-win basis for both parties.
Yoruba: "Ètò Ìlànà tuntun gẹ́gẹ́ bi ààrẹ Xi Jinping ṣe sọ, ó ní àjọ ECOWAS kò ní pẹ́ gbé ètò ìlànà kan jáde ni èyí tí yóò tún jẹ́ kí àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ECOWAS tún wá ọ̀nà mìíràn nípa ètò ọrọ̀-ajé àti láti máa ṣe okoòwò pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè China.

English: ECOWAS member states would soon introduce policies that will further diversify their economies and enhance business opportunities with China.
Yoruba: "Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ECOWAS ti ń ṣ̀etò ìlànà ti yóò tún jẹ kí ètò ọrọ̀-ajé wọn ní ìdàgbàsókè sii.

English: ECOWAS also welcomes more Chinese tourists to visit West Africa.
Yoruba: Ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ECOWAS tún fẹ́ kí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè China wá fún eré ìgbáfẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà.

English: Our sub-region is endowed with enormous tourism potentials.
Yoruba: Àwọn ẹ̀kùn wa ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ohun nǹkan ìgbáfẹ́.

English: With China's support, tourism related infrastructure should be developed to empower our citizens, create more employment opportunities among the teeming population and eliminate poverty.
Yoruba: Pẹ̀lú ìrànwọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè China àwọn ibi ìgbáfẹ́ yóò tún ní ìdàgbàsókè sí i, ní èyí tí yóò ṣe máa pèsè iṣẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ janturu àti èyí tí yóò tún jẹ́ ki òṣì di ohun àfìsẹ́yìn tí eégún ń fi aṣọ.

English: The ECOWAS Chairman expressed the region's appreciation to China for investing so much in West Africa.
Yoruba: Alága ECOWAS dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè China fún ètò okoòwò wọn nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

English: "On behalf of the Government and people of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and the Authority of Heads of State and Government of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), I wish to express our appreciation to the Government and people of the People's Republic of China for the warm hospitality extended to our delegations since our arrival in China.
Yoruba: "Láti ọ̀dọ̀ ì̀jọba, àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, àwọn Aláṣẹ àti ìjọba àjọ ECOWAS, mo fẹ́ fi ìdúpé wa hàn si ìjọba àti àwọn ọmọ Ilẹ̀ Olómìnira awon Ènìyàn China fún bí wọ́n ṣe gbà wá ní àlejò nígbà tí a dé sí orílẹ̀-èdè China.

English: "China is today, the largest investor in the sub-region, in both private and public sectors; covering areas such as infrastructure, energy, agriculture, mining, and healthcare.
Yoruba: "Orílẹ̀-èdè China lónìí, ni oludokoowo t"ó ga jùlọ ni ẹ̀kùn ìlé Áfíríkà yálà ní ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni àti ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba, tí wọn sì lọ́wọ́ nínú; ohun amáyédẹrùn, iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ètò àgbẹ̀, ohun àlùmọ́nì -ilẹ̀, ìyípadà ọjọ́ àti ètò ìlera.

English: "China also provides significant assistance in emergency humanitarian aid and response to climate change.
Yoruba: "China tún ń pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn aláìní.

English: "Various construction projects are now ongoing in the sub-region, including the construction of railway projects, power infrastructure, airports and numerous roads through Chinese financing," President Buhari stated.
Yoruba: ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iṣẹ́ àkànṣe l"ó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ tí ó sì jẹ́ pé àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè China ni wọ́n ń ṣe àwọn iṣẹ́ àkànṣe bí i ojú-irin, iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, ọkọ̀ ojú òfuurufú àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ojú ònà ọkọ̀ t"ó jẹ́ owó orílẹ̀-èdè China.

English: ---President Buhari, who reminded China of its commitment to build a befitting secretariat for ECOWAS, also pledged that West African countries will continue to encourage more foreign investments in the region.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari tún rán orílẹ̀-èdè China létí nípa kíkọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ àjọ ECOWAS tuntun, Ààrẹ wá ṣèlérí pé àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ECOWAS yóò máa ṣe ohun ìwúrí láti jẹ́ kí àwọn oníṣòwò ilè òkèèrè wá dá ilé-iṣẹ́ sílẹ́ ní ẹ̀kùn wọn.

English: He said: "Excellencies, while expressing our appreciation for the strong engagement of China with the ECOWAS sub-region, I also wish to thank President Xi Jinping for the pledge to build a befitting Secretariat for the Commission.
Yoruba: Ó ní́: "ọlọ́lá jùlọ, a dúpẹ́ fún ìpàdé tó wáyé láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè China àti àjọ ECOWAS, a tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ààrẹ Xi Jinping fún ìlérí tí ó ṣe láti kọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ ECOWAS tuntun fún àjọ náà.

English: Jordan warns of consequences as US withdraw Palestine aid
Yoruba: Jordan kìlò lórí ohun tó lè ṣẹlẹ̀ tí Amẹ́ríkà bá fòpin sí ìrànlọ́wọ́ Palestine.

English: Jordan's foreign minister has warned of "dangerous consequences to regional stability" if the Palestinian refugee agency UNRWA cannot provide services to refugees.
Yoruba: Mínístà fún ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ni Jordan, ti ṣe ìkìlọ̀ pé ó léwu tí Amẹ́ríkà bá fòpin sí ìrànlọ́wọ́ yìí nítorí pé àjọ tó ń rísí ọ̀rọ̀ àwọn aṣàtìpó Palestine UNRWA kò ní agbára láti pèsè ohun tó yẹ fún wọn lásìkò yìí.

English: The country which presently provides refuge to over two million refugees from troubled middle eastern states said the move represents a major hit for the agency, as the US had long been its biggest donor.
Yoruba: Báyìí, ó lé ní mílíọ́nù méjì aṣàtìpó tí wọn ń sàtipo láti àárín gbungbùn ilà oòrùn ní èyí tí yóò yọ sílẹ̀ ní kété tí Amẹ́ríkà bá ti yọwọ́ kúrò.

English: Foreign Minister Ayman Safadi said that Amman regrets Washington's decision to cut funding for the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine (UNRWA).
Yoruba: Ayman Safadi tó jẹ́ mínísítà fún ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ni ó bani lọ́kàn jẹ́ pé Washington yọwọ́ owo ìrànwọ́ ìrànlọ́wọ́ Àjọ ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé àti Iṣẹ́ (UNRWA) tí wọ́n ń pèsè fún Palestine.

English: The minister also said that his country will continue to rally for donor support to help ease the financial strain that the agency is currently facing.
Yoruba: Mínísítà náà ní ìjọba yóò túbọ̀ máa gbìyànjú láti máa wa àwọn olùrànlọ́wọ́ míràn láti fòpin sí ìṣòro tí àjọ náà ń kojú báyìí fún owó níná.

English: ---Meanwhile, Israeli Intelligence Minister Israel Katz praised "the decision of the president of the United States to halt all funding of UNRWA - the body that enshrines the Palestinian refugee problem."
Yoruba: ---Ohun tó kọ iwájú sí ẹnìkan ni ọ̀rọ̀ náà nítorí mínísítà ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́ fún Isreal, Isreal Katz yòmbó ìgbésẹ̀ Ààrẹ Amẹ́ríkà láti dá gbogbo owó ìrànwọ́ àjọ UNRWA - t"ó ń ṣàfikún sí ìṣoro àwọn ogúnléndé Palestine.

English: UNRWA, which began operations in 1950, assists some five million Palestinian refugees, according to its website.
Yoruba: Àjọ UNRWA, tí ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ láti ọdún 1950 ní èyí tí ó ti pèsè ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ó lè ní mílíọ́nù márùn-ún ogúnléndé Palestine.

English: Nigeria, Germany, UN hold conference on Boko haram
Yoruba: Nàìjíríà, Germany àti UN yóò ṣèpàdé lórí ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ Boko haram.

English: Nigeria, Germany, Norway, and the United Nations have converged on Berlin, on Monday for a "pledging conference on boko haram."
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, Germany, Norway, àti àjọ àgbáyé (United Nàtions) ti pàdé ní Berlin, lọ́jọ́ Ajé láti "ṣèpàdé lórí ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ boko haram."

English: The Berlin Conference, holding from Sept. 3 to 4, is jointly organized by the three countries and the UN, and is one of the 2018 largest pledging conferences for the Lake Chad region.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé ti yóò wáyé ni Berlin láti ọjọ́ kẹta sí ìkẹrin lo jẹ́ pé àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè mẹ́ta àti àjọ àgbáyé (UN) ló ṣe onígbọ̀wọ́ rẹ̀, ìpàdé ọ̀hún ní èyí tí ó lágbára jùlọ lọ́dún 2018 fún ẹ̀kùn Lake Chad.

English: The conference will focus on humanitarian assistance, civilian protection, crisis prevention and stabilization for the region, as well as seek to raise funds for the humanitarian requirements totaling $1.56 billion.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé náà ni yóò dá lórí pípèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ owó mílíọ́nù kan lé ní mẹ́rìndínlọ́gọ́ta dọ́là fún àwọn ẹ̀kùn ti ọ̀fọ̀ ṣẹ̀ sí àti pípèsè ètò ààbò.

English: The pledges at the conference, would help provide humanitarian assistance for the Northeast Nigeria and parts of Niger, Chad and Cameroon, ravaged by Boko Haram insurgents.
Yoruba: bákan náà ni ìpàdé yìí yóò tún pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ẹ̀kùn Ìlà -oòrùn Àríwá lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti apá ibìkan lórílẹ̀-èdè Niger, Chad àti Cameroon tí ikọ̀ Boko Haram ti ṣọṣẹ́ sí.

English: It would also discuss the perspectives of civil society, their concerns and contributions, as well as how to strengthen collaboration between the affected countries and organizations involved in responding to the crisis.
Yoruba: Níbi ìpàdé náà ni, wọn yóò tún máa jíròrò nípa èròǹgbà, ìmọ̀ràn àti ìrànwọ́ láti ọ̀dọ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tí kì í ṣe ti ìjọba àti ọ̀nà tí wọn yóò gbà láti máa fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí àjálù náà kọlù àti àwọn ẹgbẹ́ tí wọ́n ti ń pèsè ètò ìràwọ́ fún àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè wọ̀nyí.

English: The Nigerian delegation to the Berlin conference is being led by Nigeria's Ambassador/Permanent Representative to the UN, Prof. Tijjani Bande.
Yoruba: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Tijjani Bándé, t"ó jẹ́ aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní àjọ UN ló ṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà níbi ìpàdé náà tó wáyé ní Berlin.

English: The Nigerian envoy said recently that Nigeria had developed a 6.7-billion-dollar robust plan of action for the reconstruction, rehabilitation and resettlement of Northeast, devastated by Boko Haram activities.
Yoruba: Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ṣètò ìlànà owó tó lé ní bílíọ́nù méje dọ́là láti fi ṣàtúnṣe sí àwọn ẹ̀kùn tí ikọ̀ boko Haram bàjẹ́.

English: He stressed the need for collaboration and cooperation among countries of the Lake Chad, the donors, as well as humanitarian and development partners.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìbáṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà ní lake Chad àti àwọn tí yóò pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀.

English: Lake Chad Basin, must provide facilitation of occupational opportunities, job creation, skill acquisition and others, are central to finding lasting solution to the problem in the region.
Yoruba: Àwọn ẹ̀kùn Lake Chad gbọ́dọ̀ le è pèsè ohun amáyédẹrùn, iṣẹ́ lọ́pọ̀ janturu àti iṣẹ́ kíkọ́, lọ́nà tí yóò fi dín wàhálà t"ó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ ní àwọn ẹ̀kùn náà kù.

English: To realize all these would entail our collective commitment to a broad range of actions, facilitated by strong international cooperation and partnership, involving the UN agencies and development partners, like the World Bank and African Development Bank, among others.
Yoruba: Láti le ṣe àṣeyorí nípa àwọn ètò ìdàgbàsókè wọ̀nyí, àjọ àgbáyé bí i ilé ìfowópamọ́ àgbáyé, ilé ìfowópamọ́ ti orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà àti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ mìíràn ti ṣetán láti ṣètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè yìí, tí wọ́n bá lèe fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti le gbógun ti àwọn ìṣòro tó ń dojú kọ wọ́n.

English: The UN had also said that it would have provided assistance to no fewer than 6.1 million people affected by the Boko Haram crisis in Northeast Nigeria by the end of 2018.
Yoruba: Àjọ UN ti ní òun yóò pèsè ètò ìràwọ́ fún àwọn tí iye wọn lé ní mílíọ́nù mẹ́fà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà , tí ikọ̀ Boko Haram kọlù ní ẹ̀kùn Ìlà -oòrùn Àríwá lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà kí ọdún 2018 ó tó parí.

English: UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator for Nigeria, Mr Edward Kallon, said at a recent event in New York, that Nigeria was still facing a crisis of global magnitude.
Yoruba: Edward Kallon, t"ó jẹ́ aṣojú àjọ UN ni ẹ̀ka ètò ìrànwọ́ fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàjíríà sọ̀rọ̀ ní New York níbi ìpàdé kan pé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń kojú àwọn ìṣòro púpò.

English: Over 10.2 million people affected in three states in Northeast Nigeria, 7.7 million people in need of humanitarian assistance.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní mílíọ́nù mẹ́wàá àwọn ènìyàn tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́ta lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó wà ní ẹ̀kùn Ìlà -oòrùn Àríwá tí wọ́n nílò ètò ìrànwọ́.

English: August 30, 2018 --- Lagos state governor host Britain Prime Minister
Yoruba: August 30, 2018 --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó gba adarí ìjọba Britain lálejò.

English: Lagos state governor, Akinwunmi Ambode host Britain Prime Minister Theresa May, he told him that Lagos state is a place where investors settled.
Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Akínwùnmí Ambode gba adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain, Theresa May lálejò , ó sọ fún un pé ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó jẹ́ ibi tí àwọn oníṣòwò tẹ̀dó sí.

English: The Governor show his happiness to welcome Britain Prime minister, He said the relationship between Nigeria and Britain has being for long.
Yoruba: Gómìnà fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn láti tẹ́wọ́ gba adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ni àlejò, ó só pé ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà àti Britain ti wà láti ọjọ́ pípẹ́.

English: He said education, culture and the governance Nigerians are practicing, was leant from Britain.
Yoruba: Ó ní ìmọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́, àṣà, ìṣèlú ti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń múlò, ló jẹ́ pé láti orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ni wọ́n ti kọ́ọ.

English: Ambode added that a good place to invest, Lagos state allow investors to invest most especially they have a stable government as the economy of Lagos is big as compared to the population in Lagos, regard for the law and stable judgment.
Yoruba: Ibi tí ó dára láti dá okoòwò sílẹ̀, Ambode fi kún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, ìlú Èkó fi ààyè gba àwọn oníṣòwò láti dá ilé-iṣẹ́ wọn sílẹ̀, pàápàá jùlọ ,wọ́n ní ètò ìṣèjoba tí ó fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀, bí ètò ọrọ̀-ajé ìlú Èkó ṣe tóbi púpọ̀ sí, iye àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé inú ìlú náà, ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún òfin àti ètò ìdájọ́ tó fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀.

English: He said "we deliberated with Britain government most especially on how the Britain investors will bring development to Lagos economy.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé "a jíròrò pẹ̀lú adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain, pàápàá jùlọ lórí bí àwọn oníṣòwò orílẹ̀-èdè Britain yóò ṣe mú ìdàgbàsókè bá et̀ò okoòwò nílùú Èkó.

English: As you know that is a place where investors settled in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ ṣe mọ̀ pé ìlú Èkó ni ibi tí àwọn oníṣòwò gúnlẹ̀ sí lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Many Britain citizen have business in Lagos.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ló ní okoòwò nílùú Èkó.

English: "Governor also said as May came into Lagos, it will allow more business and security development.
Yoruba: "Gómìnà tún sọ pé bí May ṣe wá sílùú Èkó, yóò tún jẹ́ kí ètò okoòwò àti ààbò tún ní ìdàgbàsókè sí i.

English: He said Britain citizen have the opportunity to partake in many businesses in Lagos, as empowerment, technology, finance, social amenities and companies.
Yoruba: Ó ní àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ní àǹfààní láti lọ́wọ́ nínú ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ okoòwò tó wà nílùú Èkó, bi i ètò agbára, ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ, ètò ìṣúná owó, ohun amáyé-dẹrùn àti ilé-iṣẹ́.

English: Lagos has been taking many steps to encourage investors to invest.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ ni ìlú Èkó ti ń gbé láti mú ohun ìwùrí dé bá àwọn oníṣòwò láti dá okoòwò sílẹ̀.

English: We have much work done on judiciary, and Britain Prime Minister was happy with this.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iṣẹ́ lati ṣe, lórí ètò ìdájọ́, inú adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain sì dùn sí eléyìí.

English: He is ready to support us, to help money lending program and development on finance.
Yoruba: Ó sì ti ṣetán láti ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún wa láti ṣèrànwọ́ ètò èyáwó àti ìdàgbàsókè lórí ètò ìnáwó.

English: The governor said he will try to all within his capacity to establish the relationship between Lagos state and Britain the more.
Yoruba: "Ètó ìbáṣepọ̀ Gómìnà sọ pé ìjọba òhun yóò gbìyànjú láti ṣe ohun tó wà níkàwọ́ọ́ rẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ feṣè ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín ìlú Èkó àti Britain múlẹ̀ sí i.

English: He said "we have spoken on technology, social amenities and investment.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé "a ti sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ, ohun amáyédẹrùn àti ìdásílẹ̀ ilé-iṣẹ́.

English: The relationship between Lagos state and Britain started many years back.
Yoruba: Ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín ìlú Èkó àti orílẹ̀-èdè Britain bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún ṣ́eyìn.

English: As you know, Lagos was made the capital city by the Britain during the time of the colonial masters, that is why we must see that many businesses from Britain must be in Lagos.
Yoruba: Bí ẹ ti mọ̀ pé, ìlú Èkó ni orílẹ̀-èdè Britain fi ṣe olú-ìlú lásìkò ìjọba amúnisìn, Ìdí nìyí tí a gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe ri i pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ okoòwò láti orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ló gbọ́dọ̀ wà nílùú Èkó.

English: Britain Prime Minister went round Lagos and he is ready to collaborate with us to allow the Britain citizen invest more business in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ti lọ yíká ìlú Èkó, ó sì ti ṣetán láti tún fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú wa, láti tún jẹ́ kí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Britain tún dá okoòwò sílẹ̀ si i.

English: The Britain Prime Minister has shown his happiness when speaking with news men at the airport in Lagos, that he is happy to come to Nigeria especially to Lagos to see how companies are successful.
Yoruba: "Adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn nígbà tí ó ń bá àwọn akọròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ ni pápá bàálù tó wà nílùú Èkó, pé inú òhun dùn láti wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà pàápàá jùlọ sí ìlú Èkó láti rí bí àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣe àṣeyọrí.

English: He said "I am happy to come to Nigeria especially Lagos, a good relationship is between Nigeria and Britain and we have a lot of things to do in the future.
Yoruba: Ó sọ pé "Inú mi dùn láti wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, pàápàá jùlọ sí ìlú Èkó, ìbáṣepọ̀ tó dán mọ́nrán wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Britain, a sì ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nǹkan pàtàkì láti ṣe lọ́jọ́ iwájú.

English: I enjoyed Abuja and Lagos, and I'm happy with the successful economy there.
Yoruba: Mo gbádùn ìlú Àbújá àti Èkó, inú mi sì dùn bi ètò ọrọ̀-ajé ṣe ń ṣe àṣeyọrí níbẹ̀.

English: We want the economy of Nigeria and UK to develop, and invest many businesses in Nigeria, businesses in Britain will be useful in Nigeria.
Yoruba: "A fẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ọrọ̀-ajé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Uk, kí a dá ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iṣẹ́ sílẹ̀ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, iṣẹ́ tó wà lorílẹ̀-èdè Britain yóò wúlò lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: I thank the Governor of Lagos state.
Yoruba: Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

English: "He said Lagos state did so well to encourage investors in the state.
Yoruba: ""Ó ní ìlú Èkó ti ṣe gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹfà láti leè mú ìwúrí bá àwọn oníṣòwò ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

English: Mrs. May said they have made provision to borrow about seven hundred and fifty million Pound Sterling that Lagos state can benefit from.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin May, sọ pé àwọn ti ṣètò èyáwó tí iye rẹ̀ tó mílíọ́nù ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀rinléláàdọ́ta owó pọ́ùn tí ìlú Èkó náà sì le è jẹ àǹfààní rẹ̀.

English: Britain Prime Minister also said she came with her group who are engineers which Lagos state can benefit from.
Yoruba: Adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain tún sọ pé òun wà pẹ̀lú àwọn aṣojú rẹ̀ tó ní ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ, ní èyí tí ìlú Èkó lèe jẹ àǹfààní rẹ̀.

English: Investing business, she also said Britain is ready to assist Lagos state on business and that the jacket she was wearing was made in Nigeria.
Yoruba: Dídá okoòwò sílẹ̀. Ó tún sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Britain ti ṣetán láti ran ìlú Èkó lọ́wọ́ nípa ètò okoòwò àti pé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọ́n ti ṣe aṣo jáákẹ́tì tí òun ń wọ̀.

English: Part of those that came to welcome the Prime Minister at expertly 4:30pm in the evening at the airport are, Governor and his Deputy, Dr. Oluranti Adebule and the secretary to the state government, Mr. Tunji Bello and the special assistance to the government and the director of foreign affairs Prof. Ademola abass.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó wá pàdé adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain nígbà tó dé sí pápá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú ní déédé aago mẹ́rin àbọ̀ ọ̀san, ni gómìnà àti Igbákejì Gómìnà, Ọ̀mọ̀wé Olúrántí Adébulé, akọ̀wé ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀, Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Túnjí Bello àti olùrànlọ́wọ́ pàtàkì ìjọba àti olùdarí ọ̀rọ̀ t"ó jẹ mọ́ ti ilẹ̀ òkèère, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Adémọ́lá Abass.

English: ---President Buhari had an indoor meeting with Britain Prime Minister.
Yoruba: ---Ààrẹ Buhari ṣe ìpàdé bòńkẹ́lẹ́ pẹ̀lú Adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain.

English: The president of Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari and Britain Prime Minister, Theresa May had an indoor meeting at the presidential house in Abuja.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàíjíríà Muhammadu Buhari àti Adarí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Britain, Theresa May ṣe ìpàdé bòńkẹ́lẹ́ nílé Ààrẹ t"ó wà nílùú Àbújá.

English: The meeting started at the office of the president at the state house, the moment May came to the state house at expertly 12:00noon.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ófíísì ile Ààrẹ, ní kété tí May dé sí ilé-Ààrẹ ní déédé aago méjìlá ọ̀sán.

English: President Buhari and Directors at the federal government offices came to welcome May.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari àti àwọn Adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀ ni wọ́n wá pàdé May.

English: The meeting will be on the how to establish the Nigeria and Britain relationship.
Yoruba: Ìpàdé náà ni yóò dá lórí ọ̀nà tí ìbáṣepọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Britain yóò ṣe túbọ̀ fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ sii.

English: These two nations will sign a memorandum of understanding on security and development.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì yìí, ni yóò tún máa tọwọ́bọ ìwé ìgbọ́ra-ẹni yé (ìbáṣepọ̀) lórí ètò ààbò àti ìdàgbàsókè.

English: Nigeria is part of the Nations May want to visit in Africa.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà wà lára orílẹ̀-èdè tí May fẹ́ kàn sí nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

English: ---Turkey lock up suspects because of the attack on the American embassy.
Yoruba: ---Turkey ti àwọn afurasí mọ́lé látàrí ìkọlù sílé aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Améríkà.

English: Turkish police force has arrested another two suspects on the accusation that, they are part of those that attacked United State embassy which came on Monday at the capital of the country which is Ankara.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá lórílẹ̀-èdè Turkey tún ti mú àwọn afurasí méjì mííràn látàrí ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kàn wọ́n pé, wọ́n lọ́wọ́ sí ìkọlù sílé aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà (United States embassy) èyí tí ó wáyé lọ́jọ́ Ajé ní olú-ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún tí ń ṣe Ankara.

English: According to the news, those concerned said the attacked was possibly from the NATO militant.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ bí ìròyìn ṣe sọ, ìkọlù náà ni àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn sọ pé, ó ṣeéṣe kó jẹ́ pé àwọn ọmọ ogun ọlọ́tẹ̀ NATO ni ó wà nídì rẹ̀.

English: Now total number of suspects in detention is four with the two suspect that just joined them.
Yoruba: Ni báyìí, àpapọ̀ àwọn afurasí tí ó wà nínú àtìmọ́lé jẹ́ mẹ́rin pẹ̀lú àwọn méjì tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ darapọ̀ mọ́ wọn.

English: The police force said two out of the suspects were drunk during the attack.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá sọ pé, méjì nínú àwọn afurasí náà mu otí àmupara lásìkò ìkọlù náà.

English: It was also established that no one was injured in the attack.
Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìròyìn tún fi múlẹ̀ pé ẹnikẹ́ni kò farapa nínú ìkọlù náà.

English: ---Two people die at the screen sport competition in Florida.
Yoruba: ---Àwọn ènìyàn méjì ni ó kú níbi ìdíje eré ìdárayá orí ẹ̀rọ agbáwòrán ní ìpínlẹ̀ Florida.

English: One participant in the screen sport competition in Jacksonville, Florida, in America has killed himself after shut two people who died immediately.
Yoruba: Olùkópa kan nínú ìdíje ere-ìdárayá orí ẹ̀rọ agbáwòrán nílùú Jacksonville, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Florida, lórílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà tí gbẹ̀mí ara rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí ó yìnbọn mọ́ ènìyàn méjì tí wọ́n sí pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀.

English: According to the police, the name of the suspect is David Katz, twenty-four years old who is in Baltimore.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ bí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ṣe sọ, wọ́n ní, orúkọ afurasí ọ̀hún ń jẹ́ David Katz, ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rìnlélógún tí ó wá láti ìlú Baltimore.

English: So also, eleven more people were brutally injured at the recreation center around Jacksonville on Sunday.
Yoruba: Bákan náà, ènìyàn mọ́kànlá mìíràn tún farapa yánayàna ní gbàgede ìgbáfẹ́ lágbègbè Jacksonville lọ́jọ́ Àìkú (Sunday).

English: According to eye witness, it was established that, Katz was angry because of his failure to win the American football eSport event which made him to misbehave.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún ṣojú wọn, wọ́n fi múlẹ̀ pé, inú ló bí Katz látààrí pé kò jáwé olúborí nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù Amẹ́ríkà ọ̀hún (American football eSports event), ní èyí tí ó mú wu ìwà lọ́nà àìtọ́.

English: Now, the names of those injured in the incident are yet to be announced, until they pardoned their families, though some people have been showing concern on the esport event website.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, wọn kòì tíì kéde orúko àwọn tí ó fara kááṣá ìjàmbá náà, di ìgbà tí wọ́n bá tó fojúri àwọn ẹbí wọn, bí ó ti lè jẹ́ pé àwọn mìíràn tí ń ṣèdárò lórí ibùdó-ìtakùn esport.

English: Different accident is happening in Florida about some years ago, and the incident that occurred around the Pulse night club in Orland in the year 2016, the incident that killed forty nine people, also the incident that killed seventeen people in Marjory Stoneman Douglas School around Parkland in February this month.
Yoruba: Oríṣiríṣi ìjàmbá ló tí ń wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Florida láti ọdún mélòó kan ṣẹ́yìn, tí ó fi mọ́ ìjàmbá tí ó wáyé ní gbàgede ìgbáfẹ́ alẹ́ nílùú Orlando lọdún 2016 (Pulse nightclub), ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó ṣekú pa ènìyàn mọ́kàndínláàdọ́ta, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó tún ṣekú pa ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínlógún nílé ìwé Marjory Stoneman Douglas ní agbègbè Parkland nínú oṣù kejì oṣù yìí.

English: ---Iran promised to support the reformation of Syria.
Yoruba: ---Iran ṣèlérí láti ṣàtìlẹyìn fún àtúnṣe orílẹ̀-èdè Syria.

English: Iran has decided to fulfill her promise in a way to support the reformation in Syria through the provision of budget, an established politics and the support for the soldiers.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Iran ti ṣèpinnu láti mú ìlérí rẹ̀ ṣẹ lójúnà láti sàtìlẹyìn fún àtúnṣe orílẹ̀-èdè Syria nípasẹ̀ pípèsè ètò ìṣúná, òṣèlú tí ó fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ àti àtìlẹyìn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun.

English: Amir Hatami who is the Minister in charge of security in Iran told the news men during his meeting with the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and Minister for defense in the country, Ali Abdullah Ayyoub.
Yoruba: Amir Hatami tí ó jẹ́ Mínísítà tó ń mójútó ètò ààbò lorílẹ̀-èdè Iran ló jábọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ náà fún àwọn akọròyìn lásìkò ìpàdé rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Syria Bashar al-Assad àti Mínísítà tó ń mójútó ètò ààbò, Ali Abdullah Ayyoub lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.

English: The two nations had agreement to collaborate on the reformation of Syria, and will not allow other nation to partake in the reformation.
Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì jọ ní àdéhùn pé wọn yóò jọ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ mú àtunṣe bá ilẹ̀ Syria, tí wọn kò sì ní fàyè gba orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn láti lọ́wọ́ sí àtunṣe ọ̀hún.

English: Hatami said " Syria is in a junction that is important now, because the nation has gone through so difficult things, and the nation is on the way to start the reformation "according to department of finance and environment in the United nations establish it that Syria has loss three hundred and eighty eight billion dollar ($388bn) as a result of different incidents and conflict since 2011.
Yoruba: Hatami sọ pé,"Syria wà ní ìkoríta tí ó ṣe pàtàkì báyìí, nítorí àwọn ohun tí orílẹ̀-èdè yìí ti làkọjá ṣẹ́yìn lágbára púpọ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ojúnà láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ àtúnṣe ni Ó wà lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́,"Gẹ́gẹ́ bi ẹ̀ka tó ń mójúto ètò ọrọ̀-ajé ìlú àti ọrọ̀ àyíká nínú àjọ ìṣokan àgbáyé, wọ́n fi múlẹ̀ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Syria ti pàdánù ọ́ọ̀dúnrún bílíọ́nù ó lé méjídínláàdọ́rù- ún owó dollar ($388bn) látààrí onírúurú ìjàm̀bá àti ogun tí ó tí ń wáyé láti ọdún 2011 sẹ́yìn.

English: Last month, President Assad explained that the reformation of Syria is of importance to him, after many Iran citizen have lost their life and some their houses and their properties in the different incidents.
Yoruba: Nínú oṣù tí ó kọjá, Ààrẹ Assad ṣàlàyé pé, láti ṣe àtúnṣe sí ilẹ̀ Syria ló jẹ òun lógún jùlọ, lẹ́yìn tí ogúnlógó àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Iran ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn ti àwọn mìíràn sì pàdánù ilé àti àwọn ohun ìní wọn sínú ọlọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan ìjàm̀bá náà.

English: ---The airline stolen in Seattle-Tacoma has crashed in an Island.
Yoruba: ---Ọkọ̀ òfuurufú tí wọ́n jígbé ní Seattle-Tacoma ti já l"Érèkùsù kan.

English: An airline staff that stole an air plane at Seattle airport in America has crashed in an Island.
Yoruba: Òṣìṣẹ́ ọlọ́kọ̀ òfuurufú kan tó" jí bàálù kan gbé ní pápákọ̀ òfuurufú Seattle l"órílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti lọ forí ṣọ́npọ́n ní Èrèkùsù kan.

English: The authority said the airplane took off on Friday without taking permission to take off from the airport which made the government to lock up Seattle-Tacoma airport.
Yoruba: Àwọn aláṣe ní bàálù náà gbéra lọ́jọ́ Etì láìgba àṣẹ láti gbéra kúrò ní pápákọ̀ òfuurufú ní èyí t"ó jẹ́ kí ìjọba ti pápákọ̀ Seattle-Tacoma pa.

English: Two combat airlines F15 were chosen to follow and search for the airline before hearing its crash with a great noise.
Yoruba: Àwọn ọkọ̀ òfuurufú ajagun méjì F15 ni wọ́n yàn láti tẹ̀lé àti lọ wá bàálù náà kí wọ́n tó gbọ́ bó ṣe já pẹ̀lú ariwo ńlá.

English: The commissioner of Police in the area, Pearl Pasor said it was not rebels that stole the airplane but a pilot of twenty nine years old
Yoruba: Ọ̀ga ọlọ́pàá agbègbè náà, Pearl Pasor ní kì í ṣe àwọn agbẹ́sùnmómi l"ó jí i bíkòṣe ọlọ́kọ̀ òfuurufú ọmọ ọdún mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ́n.

English: A screen picture showed that, appeals were made to the man to land safely before the plane crashed.
Yoruba: Àwòrán ojúìwò kan fihàn pé wọ́n ti ń rọ ọkùnrin náà k"ó balẹ̀ l"álàáfíà k"ó tó di pé ọkọ̀ òfuurufú náà já.

English: Seattle Times newspaper described that the man as a someone who does not care about anything and have send many video clips online where he was using an airline Q400 belonging to Alaska Airlines for different display.
Yoruba: Ìwé ìròyìn The Seattle Times ṣàpèjúwe ọkùnrin náà gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹni tí kò nání nǹkankan t"ó ti fi ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwòrán-olóhùn sórí ayélujára níbi t"ó ti ń fi ọkọ̀ òfuurufú Q400 kan tó jẹ́ ti Alaska Airlines dárà lóríṣiiríṣi.

English: Leah Morse, who took the picture of how the man was landing said he took note that something was wrong with the airline on air before landing close to his house with loud noise.
Yoruba: Leah Morse, t"ó ya àwòrán bí ọkọ̀ òfuurufú náà ṣe ń balẹ̀ ni òun ṣàkíyèsí pé nǹkankan ń ṣe ọkọ̀ náà lójú òfuurufú k"ó tó wá balẹ̀ nítòsí ilé òun pẹ̀lú ariwo ńlá.

English: ---Nigerian government will charge the customer of Russian airline.
Yoruba: ---Ìjọba Nàìjíríà yóò gbé àwọn oníbàrá ìrinnà ọkọ̀ òfuurufú Russia lọ sílé ẹjọ́.

English: Federal government of Nigeria has planned to charge the customer of the airline that conveyed the lovers to Russia but failed to take them back to Nigeria, which make the people to become wanderer after the football cup competition in Russia.
Yoruba: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti pinnu láti gbé àwọn oníbàrá ọkọ̀ òfuurufú tó kó àwọn olólùfẹ́ lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Russia ṣùgbọ́n tí wọ́n kùnà láti kó wọn adà sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí àwọn ènìyàn náà di alárìnká lẹ́yìn ife ẹ̀yẹ bọ́ọ̀lù 2018 tó wáyé ní orílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: Nigeria ambassador to Russia, Prof. Steve Ugba said this on an online video clip, in which he sent to the speaker of the commission on foreign affairs Tope Elias-Fatile on Sunday in Abuja.
Yoruba: Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà sí orílẹ̀-èdè Russia ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Steve Ugba l"ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ fídíò ayélujára, ní èyí tí ó fi ránṣẹ́ sí agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ àjọ t"ó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèkèrè, Tope Elias-Fàtile lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, nílùú Àbújá.

English: Ugba made the lovers of Nigeria in Moscow, Russia understand the situation of the government before going to Nigeria.
Yoruba: Ugba jẹ́ kí àwọn olólùfẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó wà ní Moscow, ní Russia mọ̀, ipò tí ìjọba wà, kí ó tó lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Over one hundred and fifty Nigerians that are football fans that airline customers failed to return to Nigeria, in that they also went to Nigeria embassy in Moscow on 12th of July, to seek assistant from the commission after the football game competition.
Yoruba: Ó lé ní àádọ́jọ (150) olólùfẹ́ eré bọ́ọ̀lù tí wọn jẹ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tí àwọn oníbàrá ọkọ̀ òfúrufú kùnà láti kó padà wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyi tí àwọn ènìyàn náà lọ sí ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní Moscow lọ́jọ́ kejìlá oṣù keje, láti bèèrè fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ àjọ náà lẹ́yìn tí eré bọ́ọ̀lù ìdárayá t"ó wáyé lọ́dún yìí parí.

English: On the 16th the President of Nigeria Mohammadu Buhari has commanded the for foreign affairs Geoffrey Onyeama and his colleague on aviation Hadi Sirika, to convey all Nigerian back to Nigeria immediately.
Yoruba: Lọ́jọ́ kẹrìndínlógún ni Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣẹ fún Mínísítà tó ń rí sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè Geoffrey Onyeama àti akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀, t"ó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ọkọ̀ òfuurufú Hadi Sirika, láti kó gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà padà wá sí ìlú Àbújá ní kíákía.

English: Before the day an Ethiopia airline has conveyed one hundred and fifty-four people to Abuja on the 20th of July.
Yoruba: Ṣáájú ọjọ́ náà ni bàálù Ethiopia ti kó àwọn ènìyàn márùndínlọgọ́jọ wá sí ìlú Àbújá ní ogúnjọ́ oṣù keje.

English: They showed their displeasure to the President of Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari to see to it that those people return home.
Yoruba: Àwọn ènìyàn náà kò sàì fi ìdùnnú wọn hàn sí Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari láti rí i pé àwọn ènìyàn náà padà wá sílé.

English: Ugba, said the government of this nation will not allow accused go free, He now appealed to the Nigerian football fans to send their report to their ministry, so that the government will arrest the accused.
Yoruba: Ugba, ní ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè yìí kò ní jẹ́ kí àwọn ọ̀daràn náà lọ ní àlááfíà, ó wá rọ àwọn olólùfẹ́ eré ìdárayá tó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti fi ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ wọn ránṣẹ́ sí ilé-iṣẹ́ wọn, láti lè jẹ́ kí ìjọba mú àwọn ọ̀daràn náà.

English: "Give us the report about the people that cheated you, that take away your money, to give them the right punishment in Nigeria.
Yoruba: "Ẹ fún wa ní ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ tí ẹ ni nípa àwọn ènìyàn tó lù yín ní jìbìtì, tàbí tí wọ́n gbé e yín lówó lọ, kí a lè fìyà tó tọ́ jẹ wọn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: We will not allow them go unpunished.
Yoruba: A ò ní jẹ́ kí wọn lọ láì jìyà.

English: Because of this, give us the report you have about them.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, ẹ fún wa ni ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ ti ẹ ni nípa wọn.

English: He also said "we are waiting for them in Nigeria, this type of attitude shows that you are good people and that you respect yourself and your nation.
Yoruba: Ó tún sọ pé "à ń dúró de wọ́n ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, irú ìwá tí ẹ hù yìí, fihàn pé ẹ jẹ́ ọmọlúàbí, pé ẹ tún ní ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún ara yín àti orílẹ̀-èdè yín.

English: "It is not a crime that we come to Russia, for it to be a crime coming back home"
Yoruba: "Kì í ṣe ìwà ọ̀daràn ni pé, ẹ wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Russia, kí ó wá jẹ́ ìwà ọ̀daràn láti padà sílé.

English: "it is a crime for anyone that sell ticket to you, and fail to return you home after receiving the payment for the return ticket so it's not your fault."
Yoruba: "Ìwà ọ̀daràn ni, fún ẹni tí o ta ìwé ìrìnnà fún un yín, ṣ̀ugbọ́n tí ó kùnà láti kó o yín padà wá sílé, lẹ́yìn tí ó ti gba owó láti kó yín padà, nítorí náà, kì í ṣe ẹ̀bi yín.

English: He also said "we will make sure those who did this are punished under the law, so that such will not repeat itself.
Yoruba: Ó tún sọ̀ pé "A ó ri i pé a fìyà jẹ àwọn tó hu irú ìwà yìí, lábẹ òfin, tó fi jẹ pe lọ́jọ́ mìíràn, wọn kò ní hu irú ìwà bẹ́ẹ̀ mo.

English: "Ugba also said Nigeria commend thisfans has they have travelled to Russia to honor the Super Eagles in Russia.
Yoruba: ""Ugba tún sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà gbóṣùbà fún àwọn olólùfẹ́ yìí bí wọ́n ṣe lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Russia láti lo yẹ àwọn Super Eagles sí lorílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: He said this act has made Nigeria a special friend with Russia.
Yoruba: Ó ní ìwà tí wọ́n hù yìí, tí jẹ kí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ pàtàkì pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè Russia.

English: ---President Trump will renovate the presidential airplane.
Yoruba: ---Ààrẹ Trump yóò ṣàtúnṣe sí bàálù òfuurufú ti ààrẹ.

English: The President of America, Donald Trump has said he will renovate the presidential airplane by painting it red, white and blue.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, Donald Trump ti sọ pé òhun yóò ṣàtúnṣe sí bàálù òfuurufú ti ilé-iṣẹ́ ààrẹ nípa kíkùn ún ní pupa, funfun àti búlúù.

English: Trump said "it is good that the new Boeing airplane be painted red, white and blue.
Yoruba: Trump ní pé "ó dára kí bàálù tuntun Boeing jẹ́ kíkùn sí ọ̀dà pupa, funfun àti àwọ̀ aró.

English: The former president of America, John F. Kennydy and his wife choose this color in 1960.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ àná orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, John F Kennedy àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, ni wọ́n mú ọ̀dà yìí lọ́dún 1960.

English: A new stage and this new stage will end in 2021.
Yoruba: Ìpílẹ̀ tuntun àmọ́ṣá ìpílẹ̀ tuntun yìí yóò parí lọ́dún 2021.

English: Trump said this in Scotland on Sunday that, the airplane will be useful for the Presidents in the future because it will last many years.
Yoruba: Trump sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní Scotland lọ́jọ́ ìsinmi ọ̀sẹ̀ yìí pé, bàálù náà yóò tún wúlò fún àwọn"" ààrẹ lọ́jọ́ iwájú"""nítorí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún ti yóò lò.

English: Trump also said "we shall have many Presidents that benefit from this.
Yoruba: Trump tún sọ pé "a ó ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ Ààrẹ, tí wọn yóò jẹ ànfààní yìí.

English: The renovation to the airplane will be so good, and will be the best in the whole world.
Yoruba: Àtúnṣe sí bàálù òfuurufú náà yóò dára púpọ̀, yóò tún jẹ́ èyí tó dára jùlọ ní àgbáyé."

English: The American air force has two airplanes.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọmọ ogun orí òfuurufú orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́rikà ní bàálù méjì̀.

English: In 1959 President Dwight Eisenhowe used the first airplane, with red and gold paint, but during the government of President Kennedy the airplane uses a blue and white paint till today.
Yoruba: Lọ́dún 1959 ni Ààrẹ Dwight D Eisẹnhowe lo bàálù àkọ́kọ́, t"ó àwọ̀ pupa àti wúrà ṣùgbọ́n láyé Ààrẹ Kennedy bàálù náà tún lo àwọ̀ aró àti funfun, títí di òní yìí.

English: The oppositions have started sending comments on his twitter account that Russian, China and France airplane also have a red white and blue color, therefore Trump should retain the color.
Yoruba: Àwọn alátakò tí ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìṣàmúlò ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ̀ pé bàálù orílẹ̀-èdè Russia, China àti France náà ní ọ̀dà pupa, funfun àti àwọ̀ aró, nítorí náà kí Trump fi ọ̀dà náà sílẹ̀ bó ṣe wà.

English: The news house in America said President Trump is planning to renovate the airplane.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ akoròyìn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà sọ pé Ààrẹ Trump tí ń gbèrò láti ṣe àtúnṣe sí bàálù náà.

English: The news also reported that Trump want the airplane to like new "look like America's and turn from looking like Jackie Kennedy paint," that which Raymond Loewy said it look like a ship.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn tún sọ pé ààrẹ̀ Trump fẹ́ kí bàálù náà tún dà bíi tuntun "kó dà bí ti Amẹ́ríkà, kò yí kúrò ní èyí tó dà bí i ti ọ̀dà Jackie Kennedy,"" ní èyí tí Raymond Loewy sọ pé ó dà bí ọkọ̀ ojú omi.

English: The airplane has been in use for thirty years, and it was George H W Bush who first flied in it.
Yoruba: Bàálù òfuurufú náà ti lo ọgbọ̀n ọdún, Ààrẹ George H W Bush, ni wọ́n kọ́kọ́ fi gbé.

English: When President Trump won as the president of America, he spoke on his twitter account that to buy a presidential plane will cost four billion dollars, which he cancelled.
Yoruba: Nígbà tí ààrẹ̀ Trump jáwé olúborí gẹ́gẹ́ bi ààrẹ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ó sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìṣàmúlò twitter rẹ̀ pé, láti ra bàálù tí yóò máa gbé ààrẹ̀ yóò na wọn ni bílíọ́nù mẹ́rin dọ́là, ní èyí tí ó fagilé.

English: ---President Buhari arrived Hague for ICC meeting.
Yoruba: ---Ààrẹ Buhari dé sí Hague fún ìpàdé àgbáyé ICC.

English: On Sunday evening, the president of Nigeria Mohammadu Buhari arrived Netherlands before his journey to the world court for the criminal act, ICC in Hague.
Yoruba: Ní ìrọ̀lẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú ni Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari dé sí orílẹ̀-èdè Netherlands ṣáájú ìrìnàjò rẹ̀ lọ sí ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé fún ìwà ọ̀daràn, ICC nílùú Hague.

English: The president airplane landed in Rotterdamat Hague airport around 7:23pm Nigeria time.
Yoruba: Bàálù Ààrẹ balẹ̀ sí Rotterdam ní pápá òfúrufú Hague ní déédé aago méje kọjá ìṣẹ́jú mẹ́tàlélógún ọ̀sán, àkókò orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: The president of the world court ICC, Justice Eboe-Osuji, and his vice for the court Marc Perrin de Brichambut and Minister for foreign affairs, Geoffrey Onyeama, went to welcome the president at the airport.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé ICC, adájọ́ Chile Eboe-Osuji, àti igbákejì rẹ̀ fún ilé-ẹjọ́ náà, Marc Perrin de Brichambut àti Mínísítà fún ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, Geoffrey Onyeama, ni wọn jọ lọ pàdé Ààrẹ ní pápá òfúrufú náà.

English: Part of those at the airport are Oji Ngofa, Nigeria ambassador for Netherlands, Mr. Robert Petri who is the Netherlands ambasssardor for Nigeria, General Veenhuijzen, special assistant to the Netherlands King and the Directors for the ministry of foreign affairs in Netherlands.
Yoruba: Lára àwọn tó tún wà ní pápá òfúrufú náà ni Oji Ngofa, aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fún orílẹ̀-èdè Netherlands,ọ̀gbẹ́ni Robert Petri tó jẹ́ aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Netherlands fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà , ọ̀gágun Veenhuijzen,olùrànlọ́wọ́ ọba orílẹ̀-èdè Netherlands àti àwọn ọ̀gá àgbà fún ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lórílẹ̀-èdè Netherlands.

English: The special assistant to the President on media and publicity, Femi Adesina said that the President will use the opportunity to speak at the occasion of twenty years anniversary that Rome joined the world court and see to criminality.
Yoruba: Olùràlọ́wọ́ Ààrẹ lórí ìròyìn àti ìpolongo, Fẹ́mi Adésínà sọ pé Ààrẹ yóò lo àǹfààní náà láti tún sọ̀rọ̀ níbi ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún ogún ọdún tí orílẹ̀-èdè Rome wà lára ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé tó ń rí sí ìwà ọ̀daràn.

English: The president will also use the opportunity to see Mrs. Fatou Bensouda who is also an ICC lawyer.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ yóò tún máa lo àǹfààní náà láti rí arábìnrin Fatou Bensouda t"ó tún jẹ́ agbẹjọ́rò fún àjọ ICC.

English: Femi Adesina also said "he is the only president invited on the occasion of twenty years anniversary and and the directors in the ministries in Nigeria saw this invitation as a means to appreciate the support given by Nigeria for the day.
Yoruba: Fẹ́mi Adésínà tún sọ pé "òun nìkan ni Ààrẹ tí wọ́n pè fún ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún ogún ọdún àti pé àwọn ọ̀gá àgbà ilé-iṣẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà rí pípè yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bi ọ̀nà láti fi dúpẹ́ lórí àtìlẹyìn tí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń ṣe fún àjọ náà.

English: Before the President arrival at Hague, Nigeria Ambassador said though some are against the world court in charge of criminality yet President Buhari believed that the court work will put an end to criminality in the world.
Yoruba: Kí Ààrẹ tó dé sí Hague ni aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ pé b"ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn kan ń tako ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé tó ń rí sí ìwà ọ̀daràn síbẹ̀ Ààrẹ Buhari nígbàgbọ́ pé iṣẹ́ tí ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé náà ń ṣe yóò dẹ́kun àwọn ìwà ọ̀daràn l"órílẹ̀-èdè àgbáyé.

English: "Since twenty years ago Nigeria has been a back bone for the world court most especially in Africa.
Yoruba: "Láti bi ogún ọdún ṣẹ́yìn ni orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tí ń jẹ́ igi lẹ́yìn ọgbà fún ilé-ẹj̀ọ àgbáyé, pàápàá jùlọ l"órílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà.

English: Therefore, the president's journey to the world court is a way to show his pleasure to the support.
Yoruba: Nítorí náà, ìrìnàjò Ààrẹ wá sí ilé-ẹjọ́ àgbáyé jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti fi ìfẹ́ hàn sí àtìlẹ́yìn rẹ̀.

English: The ambassador also said "there is assurance that the president journey will also show that Nigeria is a supporter of Roman decision.
Yoruba: Aṣojú náà tún sọ pé ""ìdánilójú wà pé ìrìnàjò Ààrẹ yóò tún fihàn pé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà jẹ́ alátìlẹyìn fún ìpinnu Rome.

English: ---President Buhari mourns Plateau Senator, Longjan
Yoruba: ---Ààrẹ Buhari dárò ikú aṣòfin Longjan

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has extended heartfelt condolences to the National Assembly, government and people of Plateau State over the demise of Senator Ignatius Longjan, who represented Plateau South.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti bá ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin, ìjọba àti àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau dárò lórí ikú aṣòfin Ignatius Longjan tó ń ṣojú fún ilà Gúúsù ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

English: The President commiserates with family, friends and political associates of the senator, who served the state as a deputy governor, 2011-2015, and had also served the country as a career diplomat for many years.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ bá ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ àti àwọn ìsọ̀ngbè aṣòfin náà tí ó jẹ́ igbákejì gómìnà lọ́dún 2011-15, t"ó tún jẹ́ aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún kẹ́dùn.

English: The President prays that the Almighty God will grant the soul of the departed rest.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.

English: ---Police reiterates committment towards ending banditry
Yoruba: ---Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá kò ní kàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn.

English: Nigeria Police has reiterated it's commitment towards ending all banditry and other crimes in the Country.
Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá l"órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti ní òhun kò ní kàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti ìwà ọ̀daràn l"órílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: Inspector General of Police Mr. Mohammed Adamu Abubakar stated this when he visited the gallant officers who were injured during the operation that was carried out in Kuduru Forest in Birnin Gwari Local Council of Kaduna State.
Yoruba: Adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Mohammed Adamu ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí àwọn akínkanjú ọlọ́pàá tó farapa nígbà tí wọn ń wọ̀yá ìjà pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀daràn nínú igbó Kuduru tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Birnin Gwari, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna.

English: Represented by the Deputy Inspector General of Police in charge of operations, Mr. Abdulmajid Ali said he was sent by the Inspector General of Police to see the condition of the gallant officers who were injured during the operation.
Yoruba: Igbákejì adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá, Abdulmajid Ali tó ṣojú fún adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ni adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ló ní kí òun wá wo àwọn akínkanjú ọlọ́pàá náà, tí wọn farapa níbi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó wáyé pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀daràn ọ̀hún.

English: He expressed satisfaction with the pace of health improvement of the injured men, whom he said are very stable. "The Doctor treating them said there is no need to worry as they are responding to treatment."
Yoruba: Ó ní inú òun dún pẹ̀lú ìtọ́jú tí àwọn ọlọ́pàá náà ń gbà nílé ìwòsàn, ó ní. "Àwọn dókítà ń tọ́jú àwọn tó farapa náà, nítorí náà kò sí ìbẹ̀rù nípa ìtọ́jú tí wọn ń gbà."

English: He assured the injured men of receiving the best of treatment.
Yoruba: Ó wá fi dá àwọn tó farapa náà lójú pé, wọn yóò gba ìtọ́jú tó péye.

English: The DIG disclosed that, unfortunately, they lost another officer which increased the number of death to two. They are Muhammad Abubakar and Sergeant Idris.
Yoruba: Igbákejì adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá náà ní ó seni láàánú pé àwọn ọlọ́pàá méjì ló gbẹ́mìí mì. Orúkọ àwọn ọlọ́pàá tí wọn kú náà ní Muhammad Abubakar àti Sergeant Idris

English: ---The World Health Organisation has urged the Nigerian government to strengthen surveillance in nine Coronavirus prone states.
Yoruba: ---Àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera ní àgbáyé ti rọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti mójútó gbogbo ẹnu ibodè ati ibùdó ọkọ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ààrùn ohun ọsin, coronavirus, pàápàá jùlọ ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́sàn án tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: WHO Technical Officer on Health Emergence Programme, Ms Dhamari Naidoo made the appeal at a media sensitisation workshop organized by the WHO, in Abuja.
Yoruba: Alákòsóo ètò àkànse fún ètò pàjáwìrì ní ẹka àjọ WHO, arábìnrin, Dhamari Naidoo sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn nílùú Àbújá.

English: She said that some of the states in Nigeria that are highly prone to coronavirus infection includes: Abuja, Lagos, Kano, Cross River, Akwa Ibom, Port Harcourt, Enugu, Delta, and Bayelsa.
Yoruba: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà nínú ewu láti ní ààrun coronavirus lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ni: Àbújá, Èkó, Kano, Cross River, Akwa Ibom, Port Harcourt, Enugu, Delta, ati Bayelsa.

English: She, however, noted that Nigeria has strengthened diagnostic testing capacity at National Reference Laboratory in Gaduwa, Abuja and at LUTH, Lagos currently being supported to implement testing.
Yoruba: Ó tún sọ pé àjọ WHO ti ṣètò ìrànwọ́ àyẹ̀wò ní àwọn ilé ìwòsàn tó wà ní Gaduwa nílùú Àbújá àti LUTH tó wà nílùú Èkó.

English: Ms Naidoo said WHO has identify 13 countries of Algeria, Angola, Cote d'Ivoire, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Mauritius, Nigeria, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda and Zambia, which due to their direct links or high volume of travel, to China need to also increase their preparedness measures.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin Naidoo tún sọ pé àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mẹ́tàlá ló wà nínú ewu àrùn coronavirus, nítorí bí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ṣe ń yawọ àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, Algeria, Angola, Cote d'Ivoire, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Mauritius, Nigeria, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda àti Zambia.

English: Also speaking at the workshop, WHO communication expert, Ms Charity Warigon, said that the workshop was aimed at acquainting the media with terms and terminology in reporting the dreaded coronavirus.
Yoruba: Arábìnrin Charity Warigon tó jẹ́ alákòóso ẹka tó ń mójútó ètò ìròyìn ni àjọ WHO wá rọ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn láti máa ṣèwádìí ìròyìn wọn kí wọn tó gbée jáde, pàápàá jùlọ nípa ààrùn coronavirus, nítorí ìròyìn tí wọ́n bá gbé jáde ni àwọn ènìyàn máa ń gbẹ́kẹ̀le.

English: ---Germany has stated its readiness to partner with Nigeria to tackle migration issues.
Yoruba: ---Orílẹ̀ èdè Germany ti ní ohun ṣetán láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti mójútò ìṣoro ìṣikirí.

English: The German State Minister at the Federal Chancellery and Commissioner for Migration, Refugees, and Integration, H.E. Annette Widmann-Mauz stated this when she visited Nigeria.
Yoruba: Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún orílẹ̀ èdè Germany àti kọmísọ́nà fún ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ sísá kúrò lórílẹ̀ èdè, ṣíṣe àtìpó àti ìbágbépọ̀, ọbabìnrin Annette Widmann-Mauz, ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: The German Minister noted that "Nigeria plays an important role as a country of origin for refugees in Germany and that's why we need to work together as strong partners and I'm eager to see.
Yoruba: Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún orílẹ̀ èdè Germany ní " Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tí ń kó ipa pàtàkì láti ṣe àtìpò fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè wọn tó wà nílùú Germany, ìdí nìyí tí a ṣe fẹ́ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti bá wọn ṣe iṣẹ́ papọ̀, mo sì ní ìtara láti rí.

English: She explained that there was an urgent need to address the reason why people are fleeing the country.
Yoruba: Ọbabìnrin tún ṣàlàyé pé, wọn yóò gbé ìgbésẹ̀ ní kíákíá láti leè wá ojútùú sí èrèdí ohun tó ń fá kí àwọn ènìyàn máa sá kúrò ní orílẹ̀ èdè wọn.

English: She added that "in order to achieve that we need strong partners and we have good and strong partners in Nigeria. Because we need to make sure that those that come back have a perspective and a future."
Yoruba: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé "Láti leè gbé ìgbésẹ̀ nípa bí àwọn ènìyàn ṣe ń sá kúrò lórílẹ̀ èdè wọn, a nílò olùbásepọ̀ tó múná-dóko, ìdí nìyí tí a fi ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tó jẹ́ alábàásisẹ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú wa."

English: Speaking earlier, the Commissioner of the National Commission for Refugees, Migrants, and Internally Displaced Persons IDPs, Senator Basheer Garba Mohammed stated that Nigeria is a significant country in global migration discourse.
Yoruba: Ṣáájú èyí ni kọmísọ́nà tó ń mójútó, àtìpó, sísá kúrò lórílẹ̀ èdè àti àwọn tí ogun lé kúrò ní ibùgbé wọn, Aṣòfin Basheer Garba Mohammed náà sọ pé orílè èdè Nàìjíríà ń ṣiṣẹ́ ètò ìlànà nípa ti ìṣínípòkiri.

English: Nigerian Senate holds closed-door meeting with IGP
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ń ṣe ìpàdé bòǹkẹ́lẹ́ pẹ̀lú adarí àwọn ọlọ́pàá Nàìjíríà.

English: The Senate has dedicated most of Wednesday's plenary to tackling insecurity, and so resolved into a closed session, to enable the Inspector General of Police, Mohammmed Adamu to brief the Senate on security situation in the country.
Yoruba: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti wà ní ìpàdé bòǹkẹ́lẹ́ pẹ̀lú adarí àwọn ọlọ́pàá orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, Mohammed Adamu láti wa sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìṣoro tó ń dojúkọ ètò ààbò lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

English: ---President Muhammadu Buhari has strongly condemned the terrorist killing of Lawan Andimi, Chairman of the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) in Michika Local Government Area of Adamawa state, describing it as cruel, inhuman and deliberately provocative.
Yoruba: ---Ilé-iṣẹ́ ààrẹ ti ní ìgbésẹ̀ tí ẹgbẹ́ àwọn onígbàgbọ́ Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) gbe ́ jẹ́ ẹ̀tọ̀ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti fi ẹ̀hónú hàn nípa èròǹgbà wọn lórí ẹ̀sìn, ìlànà iṣẹ́ àti àwùjọ.

English: In his reaction to the incident, President Buhari expressed sorrow that the terrorists went on to kill the religious leader while giving signals at the same of a willingness to set him free by releasing him to third parties.
Yoruba: Ọlùrànwọ́ ààrẹ Buhari lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Garba Shehu ní ààrẹ bá àwọn onígbàgbọ́ kẹ́dùn, bẹ́ẹ̀ sìni inú ààrẹ tún bàjẹ́ lórí bí Boko Haram ṣe pa pásítọ̀ Lawan Andimi.

English: ---The government of the United States of America has thrown its weight behind President Muhammadu Buhari's personal commitment to the anti-corruption crusade in Nigeria.
Yoruba: ---Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ti gbósùbà fún ààrẹ Buhari lórí ipa tí ó ń kó láti gbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: In a statement issued by Morgan Ortagus, Spokesperson of the State Department at the end of the signing of the agreement between the U.S. government, the Bailiwick of Jersey, and the Government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria for the return of more than $308 million stolen by late General Sani Abacha , the US government also pledged their commitment to continue to support all other efforts by stakeholders to combat corruption at all levels in Nigeria .
Yoruba: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kàn tí Morgan Ortagus, tí ó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún ilé-isẹ́ ọ̀telẹ̀múyẹ́ fún orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà kọ̀, lẹ́yìn tí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà, Bailiwick of Jersey àti ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn láti dá mílíọ́nù $308 owó ti olóògbé Sani Abacha jí kó pamọ́ sí orílẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà padà fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, orílẹ èdè Amẹ́ríkà tún ṣèlérí láti túbọ̀ máa ṣàtìlẹyìn fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́.

English: Senior Special Assistant on Media and Publicity to the President, Garba Shehu disclosed this on Tuesday night via a presidency statement.
Yoruba: Olùrànwọ́ ààrẹ Buhari lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Garba Shehu ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Ìsẹ́gun nínú ìwé àtẹ̀jáde kàn.

English: ---President Buhari mourns former Kenyan leader Moi
Yoruba: ---Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari kẹ́dùn ikú ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Arap Moi.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has described the late former President of Kenya, Daniel Arap Moi as a frontline nationalist who gave his best for the development of his country.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti sàpéjúwe ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya tẹ́lẹ̀rí, Daniel Arap Moi gẹ́gẹ́ bí asíwájú rere , tí ó fi ohun gbogbo tí ó dára jùlọ fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè rẹ̀.

English: He said Moi was a key factor in the stability of the East African region and Africa in general.
Yoruba: Ó ní Moi jẹ́ ọ̀kan pàtàkì nínú àwọn tó jẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ẹkùn ìlà oòrùn Áfíríkà.

English: Condoling with President Uhuru Kenyatta, the government and the people of Kenya, President Buhari said: "From a humble beginning (as a school teacher), the late Arap Moi became a politician, a committed democrat, was elected President.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ tún bá ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya, Uhuru Kenyatta, ìjọba àti àwọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀ èdè Kenya kẹ́dùn lórí ikú olóògbé náà, Ààrẹ Buhari ní: "Láti ìdílé tí kò rí ọwọ́ họrí (ó jẹ́ olùkọ́), olóògbé Arap Moi di olósèlú, kí ó tó di ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè náà.

English: He prays that God Almighty will repose his soul.
Yoruba: Ààrẹ wá gbàdúrà pé kí ọlọ́run tẹ́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.

English: ---Minister says Nigeria media environment, one of the freest
Yoruba: ---Mínísítà sọ wípé ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀kan nínú ohun tó ní òmìnira jùlọ.

English: The Nigerian government says it runs one of the freest press environments in the world.
Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ti ní orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ló fi ààyè gba òmìnira nípa ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ jù fún àwọn ènìyàn ní àgbáyé.

English: The government said even though it has provided enough space for freedom, it was still expecting such freedom to be enjoyed with responsibility.
Yoruba: Ìjọba ní bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà fún àwọn ènìyàn ni òmìnira láti leè sọ ọ̀rọ̀ tó bá wù wọ́n, púpọ̀ nínú wọn ni kò mọ ẹ̀tọ́ rẹ nípa ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ.

English: Sanitisation of social media Nigeria's minister of Information and Culture, Mr. Lai Mohammed also said his ministry would this month, convene a stakeholders" meeting as part of efforts to design a framework for the sanitisation of the Social Media.
Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àṣà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Lai Mohammed, ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé nígbà tí ó ń gba aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè Finland, Jyrki Pulkkinen, àti aláákóso tó ń mójútó ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ní ẹka ètò ọgbọ́n àtinúdá fún orílẹ̀ Finland, Jarmo Sareva, wá sí ilé-isẹ́ rẹ̀ fún ìpolongo òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ.

English: The Minister stated this in Abuja on Monday when he received the Finnish Ambassador to Nigeria, Dr. Jyrki Pulkkinen, and the Ambassador of Innovation of the Foreign Affairs Ministry of Finland, Mr. Jarmo Sareva, who were on an advocacy visit to promote the ideals of the Freedom Online Coalition.
Yoruba: Mínísítà tún sọ pé àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìròyìn àti àsà yóò se ìpàdé pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn tọ́rọ̀ọ́kàn lósù yìí láti ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ẹ̀tọ́ nípa lílo ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ayélujára, lọ́nà tí wọn kò fi ní tẹ òmìnira nípa ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ àti ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn mọ́lẹ̀.

English: He said the government was responding to the irresponsible use of the Social Media to promote fake news and hate speech by some unscrupulous individuals.
Yoruba: Ó ní inú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kò dùn si bí àwọn kàn se ń lo ìmọ̀ ayélujára láti fi gbé àwọn ìròyìn ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ àti ọ̀rọ̀ tó leè dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ jáde láti fa èdè àìyedè.

English: ---APC governors to submit Constitutional Amendment Bill to National Assembly
Yoruba: ---Gómìnà ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú APC yóò fi àtúnṣe ètò òfin ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin.

English: Governors of the All Progressives Congress, APC under the platform of the Progressive Governors Forum, PGF are studying areas for constitutional amendment which they will submit to the National Assembly.
Yoruba: Àwọn gómìnà ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú APC, lábẹ́ igbimọ gómìnà tó ń mójútó ètò ìtẹ́síwájú fún àwọn gómìnà, Progressive Governors Forum, PGF ti ń ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò òfin láti ṣe àtúnṣe sí ètò òfin tí yóò mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn àti ìṣèjọba rere bá gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí wọ́n yóò fi ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin.

English: Edo state governor Godwin Obaseki who was represented by his deputy Mr. Philip Shuaibu stated this while briefing journalists in Abuja after a meeting of the PGF Steering Committee on Good Governance.
Yoruba: Philip Shuaibu tó jẹ́ aṣojú gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Edo Godwin Obaseki ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá, lẹ́yìn ìpàdé tí ìgbìmọ̀ PGF ṣe.

English: He said the committee will study the report of governor Nasir El-Rufai-led committee on restructuring and draw out the areas that need amendments from the report.
Yoruba: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún yóò yẹ ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ tí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna Nasir El-Rufai kọ̀, lásìkò tí ó ń darí ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò àtúnṣe òfin.

English: Mr Shuaibu added that the PGF is working on better synergy between the APC governors, legislators and the party in order to better drive the party's manifesto and good governance in their various states.
Yoruba: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Shuaibu tún sọ pé ìgbìmọ̀ náà ń ṣe iṣẹ́ papọ̀ pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn gómìnà tí ó wà nínú ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú APC, àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àti ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú ọ̀hún láti leè ṣe àwọn ètò àti ìlànà tí yóò mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn bá gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: Senate Leader, Yahaya Abdullahi who was at the meeting said a sub-committee has been set up to come up with key areas from the El-Rufai report that would require legislative action especially in areas of good governance both at the state and federal levels.
Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Yahaya Abdullahi, tó wà níbi ìpàdé ọ̀hún, tún sọ pé ìgbìmọ̀ tẹ̀ẹ́kótó náà yóò sàgbéyẹ̀wò ìwé àkọsílẹ̀ tí El-Rufai kọ, ní èyí tí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin yóò fẹnukò lé lórí pàápàá júlọ nípa ètò ìgbáyé-gbádùn àti ìṣèjọba rere lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

English: --- Anthony Joshua discussed on the venue of competing with Jarrell Miller
Yoruba: --- Anthony Joshua ń jíròrò lórí ibi ìgbáradì ṣaájú ìfigagbága pẹ̀lú Jarrell Miller.

English: Now, the Britain boxer, Antony Joshua is having a meeting on which field to practice before competiting with the New York boxer, Jarrell Miller in a combat for the world cup.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ẹ́ ọmọ ilẹ̀ Bìrìtìkó, Anthony Joshua ti ń ṣe ìpàdé lórí gbàgede ìgbáradì tí yóò lò kí ó tó lọ kojú ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ẹ́ ilẹ̀ New York, Jarrell Miller nínú ìtakàǹgbọ̀n fún àmì-ẹ̀yẹ àgbááyé.

English: Though, Anthony Joshua at not t any time relaxed, afte his longtime preparation for the competition.
Yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, Anthony Joshua kò fìgbà kankan túra sílẹ̀, lẹ́yìn ìgbáradì ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́ fún ìfigagbága náà.

English: The News established it that, Joshua is waiting for an assurance of the competition between himself and Miller at the Madison Square June this year.
Yoruba: Ìròyìn fi ìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé, Joshua ń dúró de àrídájú ìfigagbága náà láàrín òun àti Miller ní gbàgede Madison Square, nínú oṣù kẹfà ọdún yìí.

English: Also his losing counterpart Eddie Hearn had a meeting with Dillian Whyte on maybe the competition between them will be restaged.
Yoruba: Bákan náà ni, akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tí ó pàdánù, Eddie Hearn ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú Dillian Whyte lórí bóyá ìfigagbága wọn yóò di àtúngbékalẹ̀.

English: --- Martial extends his term in Manchester United.
Yoruba: --- Martial sún àkókò rẹ̀ síwájú nínú ikọ̀ Manchester United.

English: The French scorer, Anthony Martial who is player of Manchester United has signed a five years work agreement to extend his his term in Manchester United till 2024.
Yoruba: Atamátàsé ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè France, Anthony Martial tí ó jẹ́ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ikọ̀ Manchester United ti buwọ́ lu ìwé àdéhùn ìṣiṣẹ́ ọlọ́dún márùn-ún láti sún àkókò rẹ̀ síwájú nínú ikọ̀ Manchester United di ọdún 2024.

English: Though, different rumour is on in the market that it is possible that the football athlete will leave Manchester United.
Yoruba: Bí ó ti lẹ̀ jẹ́ pé, oríṣiríṣi àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ ló gba ojú-ọjà kan pé, ó ṣeéṣe kí agbábọ́ọ̀lù náà ó kúrò nínú ikọ̀ Manchester United.

English: Now, Martial has scored a total of ten goals in this season and help for a goal in twenty five (25) football match in this season.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, Martial ti gbá àpapọ̀ bọ́ọ̀lù mẹ́wàá sáwọ̀n ní sáà yìí, tí ó sì ṣe ìrànwọ́ ayọ̀ kan nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n ní sáà yìí.

English: Many of the footballers commend the acting coaching for Manchester Unuted, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for his hard work and the part played since he has substituted the former coach of the football club Jose Mourinho.
Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ nínú àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọ̀hún ni ó gbóríyìn fún adelé akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ikọ̀ Manchester United, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer fún iṣẹ́ takuntakun àti ipa tí ó kó láti ìgbà tí ó ti rọ́pò akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ikọ̀ náà tẹ́lẹ̀, Jose Mourinho.

English: According to Martial, I thank Ole so much and the other coaches for the their believe in me, because they helped me so much to bring increase to how I participated.
Yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Martial ṣe sọ, Mo dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ole gidi gan àti àwọn akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá yòókù fún ìgbàgbọ́ wọn nínú mi, nítorí pé wọ́n rànmí lọ́wọ́ púpọ̀ láti mú ìgbèrú bá bí mo ṣe ń kópa sí.

English: We know Manchester United football club in the past as football club that love to win the trouphy, I am so sure that very soon we will win the trouphy.
Yoruba: A mọ ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Manchester United sẹ́yìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí, ikọ̀ tí ó nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti máa gba ife ẹ̀yẹ lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀, ó dá mi lójú pé, láìpẹ́ a ó tún gba ife ẹ̀yẹ.

English: Anthony Martial joined Manchester United in 2015 from Monaco football club for thirty six million Euro (£36 million or $47m), since then he has been seing himself has one of the best young footballer.
Yoruba: "Anthony Martial dara pọ̀ mọ́ Manchester United lọ́dún 2015 láti inú ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Monaco pẹ̀lú mílíọ́nù mẹ́rìndínlógójì £36 million ($47m), láti ìgbà náà ni ó ti ń rí ara rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀kan lára agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọ̀dọ́ tí ó dára jùlọ.

English: The club football coach, Solskjaer also show his displeasure after Martial signed an agreement with the club.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ikọ̀ ọ̀hún, Solskjaer náà fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lẹ́yìn tí Martial tún buwọ́ lu ìwé àdéhùn nínú ikọ̀ náà.

English: Anthony is one of the young best football players for the club, and a player that any coach will love to have in his team, because he is easy to work with
Yoruba: Anthony wà lára agbábọ́ọ̀lu ọ̀dọ́ tí ó dára jùlọ fún ikọ̀ náà, ó sì jẹ́ agbábọ́ọ̀lù tí akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá yòówù yóò nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti ní nínú ikọ̀ rẹ̀, nítorí pé, ó rọrùn láti bá ṣiṣẹ́pọ̀,"

English: --- Sarri- I am not stopping Hazard if he want to go.
Yoruba: --- Sarri- Mi ò dí Hazard lọ́wọ́ tó bá fẹ́ lọ

English: Chelsea football club coach, Maurizio Sarri made Eden Hazard to know that he is not stopping him if he decided to be going.
Yoruba: Akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea, Maurizio Sarri ti jẹ́ kí Eden Hazard mọ̀ pé òun kò dá a dúró, tí ó bá pinnu láti máa lọ.

English: Sarri said truly he wanted Hazzard to remain in Chelsea, but he wil not stop him if he want to leave the football club.
Yoruba: Sarri sọ pé lòótọ́ òun fẹ́ kí Hazard ó ṣì wà nínú ikọ̀ Chelsea, ṣùgbọ́n òun kò ní dí i lọ́wọ́ tí ó bá fẹ́ fi ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù náà sílẹ̀.

English: Remembering that Real Madrid Football club had wanted Hazard to join her club in Spain.
Yoruba: A ó rántí pé, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lu Real Madrid ti ń fẹ́ ki Hazard ó dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ ọ̀hún ní orílẹ̀-èdè Spain.

English: And Hazard himself has said he love to join Resl Madrid, if the club is ready to buy him over.
Yoruba: Tí Hazard fúnra rẹ̀ ti sọ pe ó wu òun láti dara pọ̀ mọ́ ikọ̀ Real Madrid, bí ikọ̀ ọ̀hún bá ṣetán láti ra òun.

English: Now Chelsea football club want Hazard to sign an agreement before the former agreement will lapse next year.
Yoruba: Ní báyìí, ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea fẹ́ kí Hazard tọwọ́ bọ ìwé àdéhùn tuntun kí àdéhùn tilẹ̀ ó tó tán lọ́dún tó ń bọ̀.

English: Hazard joined Chelsea in 2012 and scored a total of ten goals for chealsea in the premier league this season.
Yoruba: Hazard dara pọ̀ mọ́ Chelsea lọ́dun 2012, ó sì ti gbá àpapọ̀ ayò mẹ́wàá sáwọ̀n fún ikọ̀ Chelsea nínú ìdíjé premier league ti sáà yìí.

English: --- Dream Stars Ladies unveils new Head Coach
Yoruba: --- Ikọ̀ agbábòọ̀lù obìnrin Dream Stars ṣàfihàn akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá tuntun.

English: The team, Dream Stars Ladies of Lagos has unveiled new Head Coach, Felix Nwosu, ahead of the 2018/2019 Nigeria Women Premier League season.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù obìnrin Dream Stars ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ti ṣàfihàn akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá àgbà tuntun, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Felix Nwosu, ṣaájú ìdíje sáà 2018/2019 ìdíje Líìgì àwọn obìnrin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà.

English: The newly promoted Lagos based team has finalised the appointment of the widely travelled Anambra born coach.
Yoruba: Ikọ̀ tí ó fi ìlú ẹ̀kọ́ ṣe ibùgbé tí ó sì ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ gba ìgbéga ọ̀hún nìgbẹ̀yìngbéyín ti gba ìlúmọ̀ọ́ká akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá ọmọ bíbí ìpínlẹ̀ Anambra yìí.

English: Felix Nwosu is an experienced coach who has stints with FC Talanta Kenya, Heegan FC Somali, FIN FA Enugu, FIN Angels, Ambassador Child Youth Club /Angels Enugu.
Yoruba: Felix Nwosu jẹ́ òjìmì akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá tí ó ti ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ FC Talanta lórílẹ̀-èdè Kenya, Heegan FC ní Somali, FIN FA nílùú Enugu, FIN Angels, Ambassador Child Youth Club /Angels nílùú Enugu rí.

English: Nomination He was nominated and recognised by Arsenal FC/ WorldRemit amongst the best 25 Youth coaches across Africa in a pool of over 700 coaches.
Yoruba: Nínú ìfanikalẹ̀ fun àmì ẹ̀yẹ, ó jẹ́ fífàkalẹ̀ àti kíkàsí láti lọ́wọ́ ikọ̀ Arsenal/ilé iṣẹ́ WorldRemit gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀kan lára àwọn akọ́nímọ́ọ̀gbá ọ̀dọ́ tí ó dáńgájíá jùlọ jákè-jádò ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀, ó wà lára akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n àkọ́kọ́ nínú àpapọ̀ akọ́nimọ̀ọ́gbá tí ó lé ní ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀rin

English: Dream Stars Ladies Chairman, Mr AbdulRahmon Abolore said; "the club opted for Nwosu because of his wealth of experience and he is confident that the former Gor Mahia defender can help the club achieve its objectives.

English: AFCON President Amaju Pinnick explained that the Confederation would only consider bids from countries with the ability to host the competition.
